Eykman, Johan Frederik (1851-1915), Dutch chemist, born 19 Jan 1851 at Nijkerk,
received primary instruction from his father, visited also schools at Zaandam, passed first

PAGE: 449
HEADING: EYLES

examen pharmacy in 1869, studied pharmacy at the University of Amsterdam until 1874 and
physics in Leiden until 1876, worked in Japan (Nagasaki and Tokyo) 1876-1885, in 1881
professor chemistry and pharmacology, returned to the Netherlands but first visited Dutch
East Indies, settled in Amsterdam, refused appointment as professor in Leiden, but went in
1897 as professor to Groningen, died 1 Jul 1915 at Groningen. (<em>Eykman</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GRO.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 522; BM 2: 550; CSP 9: 821, 12: 227, 14: 802;
IH 2: 188; Kew 2: 225; Rehder 5(index): 253, 267; SK 1: 159, 4: cxxix; TL-2/2: see index;
Tucker 1: 238.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Jaarboek Rijksuniversiteit Groningen 1914-1915. 40-43. 1915 (biogr., bibl.).
Dammerman, K.W., Ann. Jard. bot. Buitenzorg 45(1): 12. 1935.
Holleman, A.F., Notice sur la vie et l'oeuvre scientifique de Johan Frederik Eykman, Rec.
	trav. chim. Pays-Bas Belgique 35: 365-420. 1916 (bibl., portr.).
Moll, J.W., Herb. Hort. bot. Groningen 30. 1918.
Sirks, M.J., Indisch Natuuronderzoek 205, 233. 1915.
Tschirch, A., Handb. Pharmakognosie ed. 2. 1: 1045. 1932 (as Eykmann, Friedrich Johann
	[sic]).

	<em>3 pl</em>. 1887.

Eyles, Frederick (1864-1937), British botanist and plant collector, born 1864 in Bristol,
worked for the Department of Agriculture in Rhodesia collecting plants in that country from
1900 until his death on 28 Mai 1937 at Salisbury. (<em>Eyles</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BM, IMI, K (4100), MO, PRE, SAM (1235), SRGH (orig. herb.
6000).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 522; BL 1: 55, 294; BM 6: 311; Bossert p. 120;
Desmond p. 214; IH 2: 188; Kew 2: 226; LS suppl. 7812.

[Transactions of the Royal Society of South Africa ... 1916]. Oct. (<em>Rec. pl. S. Rhodesia</em>).

PAGE: 450
HEADING: EYMA

<em>Publ</em>.: 20 Mai 1916 (date on cover, Nat. Nov. Dec (1-2) 1916), cover (identif.), p. 273-564.
	<em>Copies</em>: G, NY. - Issued as Trans. roy. Soc. S. Afr. 5(4). 1916.
<em>Ref</em>.: Cotton, E.M., Bot. Centralbl. 134(15): 235. 10 Apr 1917 (short note).

*Eyma, Pierre Joseph (1903-1945), Dutch botanist, born 30 Sep 1903 at Maarssen, visited
the gymnasium at Utrecht and entered the university in that town in 1922, Dr. sci. in 1932,
from 1939 assistant for botany until 1937 mainly revising families for the Flora of Surinam,
went to the Dutch East Indies in 1937 for exploration of the flora in several selected areas,
was prisoner of war on Java and Sumatra during WW II, died in camp on 25 Jul 1945. (<em>Eyma</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BO (coll. Indonesia), L (Dutch coll.), U (European coll.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: IH 2: 188; Kew 2: 226; SK 1: 159-161, 603, 4: cxlvii, cxlviii,
cl, clvi; TL-2/4: see index.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Steenis, C.G.G.J. van, Pierre Joseph Eyma In memoriam, Bull. Bot. Gard. Bui-
	tenzorg ser. 3. 18(4): 403-406. Jan 1950 (portr.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: <em>Polygonaceae</em>, <em>in</em> A.A. Pulle, Flora of Suriname 1(1): 49-71. Mar 1934,
<em>Guttiferae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 3(1): 65-118. Mar 1934, <em>Lecythidaceae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 3(1): 119-155. Mar 1934,
<em>Punicaceae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 3(1): 156-157. Mar 1934, <em>Bixaceae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 3(1): 158-159. Mar 1934,
<em>Sapotaceae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 4(1): 354-399. Jul 1936.

33.653. Notes on <em>Guiana Sapotaceae</em> ... Extrait du Recueil des Travaux Botaniques Néerlan-
dais ... 1936. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Mar 1936 (in journal), cover-t.p., p. [156]-210, loose errata sheet. <em>Copies</em>: B, FAS(B),
	G, L, U. - Reprinted and to be cited from Recueil Trav. bot. Néerl. 33: 156-210. 1936.
<em>Note</em>: Also issued as Meded. bot. mus. herb. Utrecht no. 27.

Eyndhoven, Gerard Leendert van (1906-1990), Dutch entomologist and mycologist, born
29 Mar 1906 at Amsterdam, moved 1922 to Haarlem, shortly after WW II appointed as
entomologist at the zoological museum in Amsterdam, recieved a Dr. honoris causa from the
University of Amsterdam in 1967, especially interested in Gasteromycetes, died 18 Oct 1990.
(<em>Eyndh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: L (Fungi).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: IH 2: 188.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Brummelen, J. van, In memoriam Dr. G.L. van Eyndhoven, Coolia 34(1): 2. 1991.
Palmer, J.T., Nova Hedwigia 15: 144. 1968.

33.654. Das genus Tulostoma in den <em>Niederlanden</em> ... <em>Geastrologische Notizen</em> ... Uebersicht
über die <em>Verbreitung</em> der genera <em>Geastrum</em>, Myriostoma und Astraeus in den <em>Niederlanden</em>
... [Overdruck uit de Mededelingen van de Nederlandsche Mycologische Vereeniging ...
1937]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Oct 1937 (in journal, p. 11 and 18 signed Apr 1935, p. 48 signed Mai 1937), cover-t.p.,
	p. [3, t.p.], [5, index], [7]-11, [12]-19, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (uncol. phot.), [20]-48. <em>Copy</em>: L. - Reprinted
	and to be cited from Med. Ned. mycol. Ver. 24: 7-48. 1937.
<em>Note</em>: Three different articles combined in one reprint.

Eyrich, Ludwig (1841-1892), German zoologist and botanist, born 6 Mar 1841 at Mannheim,
visited schools in that town and went 1857 to the polytechnical high-school in Karlsruhe, in
1859 to the University of Heidelberg, Sr. sci. in 1863, teacher in natural sciences in
Mannheim, died from heart troubles 26 Jun 1892. (<em>Eyrich</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

PAGE: 451
HEADING: EYSENHARDT

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 522; De Toni 1: xlv, 2: xlviii; Nordstedt p. 14.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Förster, F., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 10: (53)-(54). 1892 (biogr.).
Prescott, G.W., Bibl. Desmid. Univ. 150. 1984.

33.655. Beiträge zur <em>Kenntniss</em> der <em>Algenflora</em> der Umgebung <em>Mannheims</em> ... [Jahresber.
Mannheimer Ver. f. Naturk. 1866]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1866, p. 110-146, <em>1 pl</em>. (col. lith.). <em>Copies</em>: B, NY. - Reprinted and to be cited from
	Jahresber. Mannheimer Vereins Naturk. 1866: 110-146, <em>1 pl</em>.

Eys, Jan Nicolaas van (1743-1818), Dutchman, born 5 Mai 1743 at Amsterdam, 1786
administrator of the East Indian Company, in 1913 in the administration of the town of
Amsterdam, member of the Royal Netherlands Institute and director of the Scientific Society
at Haarlem, much interested in agriculture, died 10 Mai 1818. (<em>Eys</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: CSP 2: 537; Rehder 5(index): 267; Tucker 1: 238.

Boerlage, J.G. and P.P.C. Hoek, Bibl. Flora Fauna Nederland 1753-1886. 36. 1888.

33.656. <em>Over de</em> eigenschappen en het nut van den <em>Kanadaschen popel</em> (Populus monilifera

	Verh. Eerste Kl. kon. Ned. inst. Wetensch. Amsterdam 3: 169-192, <em>pl. 1-2.</em> 1917.

Eysel, Georg (1909-x), German botanist, born 21 Jun 1909 at Marburg (Lahn), visited from
1915-1918 the Bürgerschule Süd at Marburg and from 1918-1927 the Gymnasium Philip-
pinum ib., studied natural sciences at Marburg and Berlin, later also medicine. (<em>Eysel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

33.657. Die <em>Embryosackentwicklung</em> von <em>Limnanthes Douglasii</em> R.Br. Inaugural-Dissertation

Eysenhardt, Carl (Karl) Wilhelm (1794-1825), German physician, zoologist and botanist,
born 21 Jan 1794 at Berlin, became professor extraordinarius at Königsberg in 1822, died 25
Dec 1825. (<em>Eysenh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(2): 704; Barnhart 1: 522; BM 2: 551; CSP 2: 537; Kew
